title: East Marton Canal Walk Route

images.title: Houses in East Marton by Andrew Abbott, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Houses in East Marton

images.title: Canal at East Marton by Andrew Abbott, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Canal at East Marton

images.title: Williamson Bridge, East Marton by Alexander P Kapp, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Williamson Bridge, East Marton

images.title: Andy Beecroft / Kelds Well Syke - next to the Leeds and Liverpool Canal
images.caption: Kelds Well Syke - next to the Leeds and Liverpool Canal. This is on a very rural and pretty part of the canal. The canal takes an extremely twisty route at this point, presumably to 'contour hug'.

images.title: Chris Heaton / Middle of the Bank Newton Locks System
images.caption: Middle of the Bank Newton Locks System. This is about half way up the Bank Newton system of locks on the Canal.

images.title: Bridge 168 Priest Holme Changeline Bridge on the Leeds Liverpool Canal by Andrew Abbott, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Bridge 168 Priest Holme Changeline Bridge on the Canal

images.title: Double bridge at East Marton by Andrew Abbott, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Double arched bridge at East Marton. The original pack-horse bridge over the canal was transformed into a double-arched bridge when the new A59 road was built on top of it.

images.title: Chris Heaton / Pennine Way near Scaleber Hill
images.caption: Pennine Way near Scaleber Hill. Pennine Way in relatively benign country between East Marton and Gargrave.

description: This circular walk from the Yorkshire village of East Marton takes you along the Leeds and Liverpool Canal to neighbouring Gargrave before returning to the village along a section of the Pennine Way. The walk starts in the village and follows the towpath north to Newton Locks Bank and Bank Newton. You pass a weir and aqueduct around Priest Holme Bridge before coming to Scarland Lock on the outskirts of Gargrave. Here you can pick up the Pennine Way and follow the waymarked footpath south west past Scaleber Hill, Netcliffe Hill and Williamson Bridge before returning to East Marton.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Head south along the canal and you could visit nearby Barnoldswick. Just to south east you'll find the villages of Thornton-in-Craven and Elslack where you can enjoy a peaceful walk around Elslack Reservoir. There's also a fine 17th century pub in Elslack village which is well worth a visit. Just to the north is neighbouring Earby where you can visit the delightful Earby Waterfalls on the Wencliffe Brook. For more walking ideas in the area see the Yorkshire Dales Walks page.

display_address: Williamson Bridge, Martons Both, East Marton, North Yorkshire, York and North Yorkshire, England, BD23 3LP, United Kingdom
